newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: SOCCER-TINA TURNER FANS LEAVE AJAX PITCH WORSE FOR WEAR.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-TINA TURNER FANS LEAVE AJAX PITCH WORSE FOR WEAR.

text.p: Thousands of Tina Turner fans danced through the first live pop concert at Ajax Amsterdam's Arena soccer ground, giving Ajax a Monday morning hangover -- big bald patches on the pitch.

Ajax moved to the new 51,000-seater arena with its retractable roof during August but have struggled to find the form that saw them crowned league champions for the third year in succession last season.

The ANP news agency on Monday reported crowds of joyous Turner fans sang and danced their way through her two-hour concert on Saturday, leaving the pitch without grass by the corner flags and with big areas patched up with sand.

Barely a month into the season and with only four soccer games played at the Arena, the pitch has only a couple of weeks to recover before the pop fans return with Michael Jackson scheduled for two concerts at the end of September.

Quite apart from Ajax's alarming loss of form, the Amsterdam club has been bedevilled by problems with the playing surface which, despite its computer-controlled heating and air-flow management, has been criticised for looking patchy and for altering the natural bounce of the ball.
Ajax are currently a modest ninth in the first division.
